Title:
Boletus rubriceps, a new species of porcini from the
southwestern USA
Keywords:
Boletaceae, porcini, molecular phylogenetics, new species,
taxonomy
Abstract:
The porcini (Boletus s.s.) are an economically important
group of ectomycorrhizal fungi whose basidiocarps have a white tube
layer, reticulate stipe, and firm white flesh. Here we describe a new
species of porcini, Boletus rubriceps. Morphological characters and
molecular data (ITS and LSU) place this species near to the European B.
edulis and north American B. edulis var. grandedulis.
